column4: I'm always open to different stuff. But I seem to migrate back to Gnome all the time lately
gnome is great, except for older hardware, where it starts to chug
good thing I gutted my system and put fast stuff in it a year ago. It' now almost up to the speed of machines you can buy for 500 bucks just about anywhere. LOL
Is there a reason you don't want Breezy?
I screwed up my system completely in trying to upgrade to Breezy
wow, really -- I hit a few speedbumps, but all ended well (Breezy is stable now of course)
good for you. I had a bunch of stuff non official, and maybe that was my problem
Just wanted you to be aware (if you weren't already) that Breezy is now stable :-)
there's another weekend coming up. Hopefully I can try another update. Last time I managed a partial one, and I was able to experience Gnome 2.12 for a bit. I really liked it.
Breezy appears to be an improvement overall over Hoary
change /etc/apt/sources.list (hoary -> breezy), then 'apt-get update && apt-get dist-upgrade'
you may have to repeat the command a few times until everything settles down, but otherwise it worked nicely for me :-)
so just change everything that says Hoary to Breezy?
I understand the repeated commands. Been through that
Cool. That's what I did before, but maybe if I try it again
make sure your data is backed-up if you can :-)
the only real stuff I need is my address book and I've done that. All bookmarks can be figured out later
